home.title: Q-CHAT-10 (Quantitative Checklist for Autism in Toddlers)
home.subtitle: For Ages 18-24 Months
home.description: A quick referral guide for parents to complete about their toddler (18-24 months) with concerns about autism. Video-based screening with 10 questions to help identify early signs.

step1.title: Welcome to Your Screening! ðŸ‘‹
step1.description: This video-based assessment will guide you through 10 simple questions about your child. Let's take a quick tour of the features to make this easy.

step2.title: Track Your Progress
step2.description: Watch your progress here! You'll always know how many questions you've completed and how many remain.

step3.title: Need Help Understanding?
step3.description: Every question has "Watch" and "Listen" buttons. Watch shows a video example, and Listen reads the question aloud for you.

step4.title: Quick Response Buttons
step4.description: For the fastest experience, simply tap "Yes" or "No" after each question. These suggestion chips appear below the chat input.

step5.title: Hands-Free Voice Input
step5.description: Prefer to speak? Click the microphone button and say your answer out loud. Perfect for multitasking parents!

recommendations.title: Recommendations
lowRisk: Your child's responses indicate typical development
Discuss any concerns with your pediatrician at regular check-ups
mediumRisk: Follow up with your pediatrician within 1-2 months
Early intervention can make a significant difference
highRisk: Responses indicate significant concerns for autism spectrum disorder
Contact your pediatrician immediately for referral
You are taking the right step by seeking evaluation

lowLikelihood.title: Low likelihood (0-2 points)
lowLikelihood.description: The child's development appears typical for their age based on this screening. No immediate action is needed at this time. If the child is under 24 months old, they will be automatically re-screened after their second birthday to ensure continued healthy development.

mediumLikelihood.title: Medium likelihood (3-7 points)
mediumLikelihood.description: Some responses indicate potential concerns. Follow up with your pediatrician within 1-2 months. Consider a comprehensive developmental evaluation. Early intervention can make a significant difference.

highLikelihood.title: High likelihood (8-20 points)
highLikelihood.description: The child may benefit from a comprehensive developmental evaluation. A clinician will reach out within one week to discuss early intervention and support options that can make a significant difference.

questionBreakdown.title: Question Breakdown
questionBreakdown.editModeInfo: Edit Mode: Click on patient answers (Yes/No/Skipped) to toggle them. AI interpretations are auto-calculated and cannot be edited.

qchat.subtitle: For Ages 18-24 Months
qchat.description: Quantitative Checklist for Autism in Toddlers - A quick, video-based screening tool to help identify early signs of autism.
qchat.watchVideo: Watch the video example, then select the option that best describes your child's behavior
qchat.watchBothVideos: Watch both video examples, then select the option that best describes your child's behavior
qchat.selectAnswer: Which option best describes your child?
qchat.noVideosAvailable: Video examples are currently unavailable for this question. Please answer based on the question text.

questions.q1: Does your child look at you when you call his/her name?
questions.q2: How easy is it for you to get eye contact with your child?
questions.q3: Does your child point to indicate that s/he wants something? (e.g. a toy that is out of reach)
questions.q4: Does your child point to share interest with you? (e.g. pointing at an interesting sight)
questions.q5: Does your child pretend? (e.g. care for dolls, talk on a toy phone)
questions.q6: Does your child follow where you're looking?
questions.q7: If you or someone else in the family is visibly upset, does your child show signs of wanting to comfort them? (e.g. stroking hair, hugging them)
questions.q8: Would you describe your child's first words as:
questions.q9: Does your child use simple gestures? (e.g. wave goodbye)
questions.q10: Does your child stare at nothing with no apparent purpose?
